sentence.Network_en: Clothing doesn't need to be overt to be sensual.
sentence.Network_cn: 衣着没有必要过于性感。

sentence.Network_en: They focus on overt discrimination rather than insidious aspects of racism.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们关注的是公开的歧视，而不是种族主义的一些潜在问题。

sentence.Network_en: The tactics employed can range from overt bullying to subtle emotional blackmail.
sentence.Network_cn: 从公然威吓到微妙的情感胁迫，各种战术都用上了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, past participle of &B{ovrir 'to open', from Latin aperire

entry.tran: 公开的；明显的；不隐藏的
entry.def: An overt action or attitude is done or shown in an open and obvious way.

example.ex: His recent productions have been beautifully crafted works with little overt political content...
example.tran: 他最近所创作的都是些精雕细琢的作品，少有鲜明的政治内容。

example.ex: Although there is no overt hostility, black and white students do not mix much.
example.tran: 虽然黑人学生与白人学生之间没有公开的敌意，但他们也不怎么来往。

means.word_mean: 1. open and observable; not secret or hidden;

sentences.en: We should learn to fight with enemy in an overt and covert way.
sentences.cn: 我们应学会同敌人做公开和隐蔽的斗争。

sentences.en: His opponent's intention is quite overt.
sentences.cn: 他的对手的意图很明显。

jushi.english: Many women at work have to deal with overt sexism.
jushi.chinese: 大多数妇女在找工作时不得不面临明显的性别歧视。

jushi.english: There was no overt hostility between the two men.
jushi.chinese: 这两人之间没有公开的敌视。
